III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code CCI Rule 400.4142 Health services; policies and procedures.
Title & (1) An institution shall establish and follow written health service
Section policies and procedures addressing all of the following:
Description (a) Routine and emergency medical, and dental, and behavioral
health care.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
1

Allegation Youth was hit by another youth, resulting in a bruised/fat lip. The
unit was outside when youth was picking flowers. Another youth
walked up, snatched the flowers out of youth’s hand. Youth
pushed the fence instead of engaging in a physical altercation with
the youth. The other youth retaliated by grabbing and punching
youth, youth punched the other youth back. There was blood
dripping from his jaw, but that no medical treatment was received.
Investigation INTERVIEWS:
Complainant was interviewed via phone on 8/6/24.
Complainant reported on 8/15/24, she took a picture of Youth A,
and the left corner of his lip was bruised, swollen and had a red
mark. Complainant reported Youth A has a history of fighting with
other youth at this facility and at a previous facility. Complainant
reported she is mainly concerned she wasn’t notified the fight
occurred because she wants the ability to hold Youth A
accountable for his actions and can’t do that if she doesn’t know
what happened.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on 7/23/24
and 8/8/24. Youth A reported on or about 7/12/24, J pod youth
and staff went outside. Youth A reported he went out to the grassy
field and picked flowers. Youth A reported he went too far onto the
field and was too close to the gate. Youth A reported Youth B
approached him and told him he needed to get away from the
fence. Youth A reported he felt like Youth B was trying to act like a
staff, so he became angry. Youth A reported Youth B ripped the
flowers he picked out of his hand. Youth A reported he was trying
to de-escalate himself, so he turned around, faced the fence and
pushed against the fence to avoid pushing Youth B. Youth A
reported Youth B pulled him away from the gate, so Youth A said,
“get off me”, and punched Youth B. Youth A reported Youth B
punched him in his jaw and he was spitting up blood. Youth A
reported he fell to the ground, and Youth B grabbed his shirt and
began dragging him across the ground, which ripped his shirt.
Youth A reported Staff 1 was outside and witnessed everything,
but he couldn’t remember which other staff were present. Youth A
reported none of the staff stopped the fight from happening or
Youth B’s actions towards him after the fight. Youth A reported
staff were telling Youth B to handle the situation and encouraging
the fight to happen since they didn’t try to stop it. Youth A reported
he refused to go inside the building when everyone else did, so
Supervisor came outside to speak with him and encourage him to
go back inside. Youth A reported he bit his lip when Youth B
punched him, which caused him to have a busted lip. Youth A
reported he didn’t feel he needed medical attention, and refused
medical attention when it was offered. Youth A reported he asked
2

for ice, which was provided. Youth A reported he went to medical
the following week after a different fight with a different youth, and
the swelling to his face/jaw already went down, so there was no
other treatment needed.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on 7/23/24.
Youth B reported J pod staff and youth were outside playing.
Youth B reported staff/security (couldn’t remember who) told
Youth A to get away from and off the fence, but Youth A wouldn’t
listen. Youth B reported staff/security told all the youth before they
went outside if youth didn’t listen while outside, everyone would
have to go back inside. Youth B reported he didn’t want to see
everyone punished for Youth A’s actions, so he went over to the
fence to try and hold Youth A accountable for his actions, in a
mentor role. Youth B reported he told Youth A to get off the gate
because if he didn’t, they would all have to go inside, but Youth A
refused. Youth B reported Youth A then grabbed the fence like he
was going to climb it, so Youth B put his arms in between Youth A
and the fence and pushed Youth A off the fence. Youth B reported
Youth A responded by hitting Youth B in his chest. Youth B
reported he then punched Youth A in his face. Youth B reported
Youth A refused to go inside, so they all went inside while
Supervisor stayed outside with Youth A. Youth B reported no one
dragged Youth A on the ground or ripped his shirt. Youth B
reported no staff encouraged or instigated the fight. Youth B
reported staff/security were present, were trying to de-escalate the
situation and did their jobs appropriately.
Youth C was interviewed face to face at the facility on 7/23/24.
Youth C reported he didn’t remember the situation or which staff
were involved.
Youth D was interviewed face to face at the facility on 7/23/24.
Youth D reported he was outside playing basketball with some
other youth on the pod. Youth D reported Youth A kept going on
the grass by the fence, which is not allowed. Youth D reported
staff/security (couldn’t remember who) kept telling Youth A not to
go over there and asked him to get away from the fence, but he
wouldn’t listen. Youth D reported they are a “peer run program”,
so they’re supposed to mentor each other and hold each other
accountable for their actions to help each other achieve success
and graduate from the program. Youth D reported all the youth
knew if Youth A wasn’t listening, they would all have to go inside,
so Youth B tried to go over to Youth A as a mentor and encourage
him to listen. Youth D reported Youth B had been trying to help
Youth A since he arrived on the pod. Youth D reported Youth A
3

responded to Youth A’s mentor efforts by punching him, but he
couldn’t remember if Youth B punched Youth A back. Youth D
reported staff/security (couldn’t remember who) were right there
trying to de-escalate the situation and encourage Youth A to do
the right thing, but he continued to refuse to listen. Youth D
reported staff/security reacted quickly and appropriately. Youth D
reported they never instigated or encouraged Youth A and Youth
B to fight.
Youth E was interviewed face to face at the facility on 7/23/24.
Youth E reported the youth and staff from the pod were outside
and he was playing basketball, but watched the situation occur.
Youth E reported Staff 1 and other staff (couldn’t remember who)
told Youth A to get off and away from the gate, but Youth A
wouldn’t listen. Youth E reported Youth B went to the gate to
encourage Youth A to get off the gate, but Youth A responded by
turning around and punching Youth B. Youth E reported Youth B
then punched Youth A. Youth E reported Staff 1 and other staff
(couldn’t remember who) intervened immediately, but Youth A and
Youth B already stopped throwing punches. Youth E reported no
staff encouraged the fight or told the other youth to get involved.
Youth E reported Youth A was never dragged across the ground
and his shirt was never ripped.
Supervisor was interviewed face to face at the facility on
7/23/24. Supervisor reported after the incident occurred, he was
called to assist because Youth A did not want to come inside.
Supervisor reported when he got outside, Youth A said, “They
wouldn’t let me be on the fence, but in my last placement I was
told I could turn around and put my hands on the fence instead of
punching or pushing someone.” Supervisor reported Youth A
continued to refuse to enter the building until Supervisor allowed
him to repick the flowers he lost during the fight. Supervisor
reported when they went inside, Youth A immediately picked up a
phone in the treatment room and broke it. Then, Youth A informed
Supervisor he wanted to call CPS, but wouldn’t share why.
Supervisor reported Youth A is frequently the antagonist in
altercations on the unit. Supervisor reported Youth B is a higher-
level peer in the program and works hard to mentor, counsel, and
provide peer guidance to other peers. Supervisor reported they
encourage youth to help guide and encourage each other to
achieve success and come to resolutions. Supervisor reported
Youth A refused medical attention because he stated he did not
think it was needed; however, Youth A was provided with ice.
4

Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 8/8/24.
Staff 1 reported he was outside with youth from J Pod. Staff 1
reported youth aren’t supposed to be on the grass, but Youth A
wanted to pick some flowers. Staff 1 reported he told Youth A he
could pick some flowers, but to stay in the area he outlined, and
directed him not to go by the fence. Staff 1 reported after a couple
minutes, Youth A took off running towards the fence and grabbed
onto it. Staff 1 reported Youth B went over to the fence and was
encouraging Youth A to let go and get away from the fence so as
not to ruin outside time for the entire group. However, Youth A
turned around and punched Youth B, so Youth B returned the
punch, and then backed off immediately. Staff 1 reported Youth A
dropped himself to the ground, began crying, and wouldn’t get up.
Staff 1 reported since Youth A would not get up and come inside,
they called and asked Supervisor to come out and assist. Staff 1
reported no adults were encouraging the fight to happen. Staff 1
reported it was difficult to prevent the situation because everything
escalated and de-escalated quickly. Staff 1 reported he did not
offer Youth A medical treatment since he went inside after the
incident, and he has no knowledge of any medical treatment
Youth A may or may not have received.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 8/8/24.
Staff 2 reported a few days after Youth A arrived at the facility, J
pod went outside on a really hot day. Staff 2 reported the whole
pod was told prior to going outside if they messed up and didn’t
listen, everyone would have to go back inside. Staff 2 reported
youth are not allowed on the grass outside without permission,
and they’re not allowed to be on or near the fence at all. Staff 2
reported Youth A went by the fence and began holding onto it.
Staff 2 reported Youth B tried to encourage Youth A to get away
from the fence, and when Youth A didn’t listen, Youth B tried to
pull him away from the fence. Staff 2 reported as soon as Youth B
put his hands on Youth A, Staff 2 asked Youth B to back away
from Youth A and the fence. Staff 2 reported Youth A turned
around and punched Youth B, so Youth B punched Youth A back.
Staff 2 reported after Youth B punched Youth A, Youth B backed
up, and Youth A fell to the ground. Staff 2 reported the other youth
tried to pick Youth A up off the ground because it was hot, but
they never dragged him, pulled his shirt or ripped his shirt. Staff 2
reported Youth A wouldn’t get up or go inside, so they asked
Supervisor to come outside and handle it. Staff 2 reported when
Youth A came inside, Staff 2 told him he would take him to
medical to get checked out, but Youth A refused even though his
mouth was bleeding. Staff 2 reported youth are encouraged to
5

provide mentoring to other youth in the program to build peer
relationships and accountability but are told not to use force.
Chief Administrator was interviewed face to face at the
facility on 7/23/24. CA reported if a youth is not restrained, an
incident report would not typically be written for youth fighting with
each other, and the parents/worker wouldn’t be notified of the
incident. CA reported Youth A has been in many fights since being
at the facility and has even had to move pods because of his
frequent altercations with other youth.
DOCUMENTS REVIEWED:
• There is no medical report after this incident as Youth A
self-reported he refused medical treatment offered.
• Picture of Youth A dated 7/15/24 shows the left corner of
Youth A’s lip has a small mark.
• Use of Outside Recreation Area policy notes if one youth
has to leave the area, all remaining youth must leave the
area as well. Youth must always stay on concrete.
• Emergency Medical Services policy states when a youth
needs emergency medical care, the supervisor is to take
the youth to the on-duty nurse for treatment and evaluation
or call the on-call facility physician. An unusual incident
report must be filled out for medical emergencies.
• Statement of Youth and Family Rights states a youth has
the right to a safe and nurturing environment, including the
right to medical care.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance as per staff and youth
interviews, as well as documentation reviewed, Youth A refused
medical treatment offered to him, and did not request medical
treatment for his injuries.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
6

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
